headline: Is TJX Companies (TJX) Still Attractive After Recent Pullback And Strong Multi‑Year Gains
summary: If you are wondering whether TJX Companies is priced attractively right now, it helps to step back and look at both the recent share moves and what current valuation signals are saying. The stock closed at US$147.47, with returns of a 3.9% decline over the past week, a 5.1% decline over the past month, a 4.4% decline year to date, but gains of 18.4% over 1 year, 91.2% over 3 years and 131.6% over 5 years, which can change how investors think about risk and opportunity. Recent news coverage...

headline: 5 Stocks With High ROE to Buy as Markets Bask in Economic Strength
summary: High-ROE picks like ANET, GLW, BBVA, TJX and TEL stand out as markets rally on strong earnings and steady Fed policy.

headline: Is TJX (TJX) Turning Steady Same-Store Gains Into a Durable Off-Price Advantage?
summary: TJX Companies recently reported that fiscal third-quarter same-store sales rose 5% across all its banners, underscoring the appeal of its off-price model during a challenging retail backdrop. This performance highlights how TJX’s opportunistic inventory sourcing and focus on branded bargains can support traffic and sales even when many retailers face headwinds. We’ll now examine how this resilient same-store sales growth shapes TJX’s investment narrative and what it might mean for...
